content: The methanol/water (V:V = 1:10) solution containing 0.018 mol/L of cobalt nitrate hexahydrate, 0.145 mol/L of Hmim, and 0.012 mol/L of ammonium oxalate was used as electrolyte for electrodeposition of metal–organic frameworks ZIF-67. The CS as a working electrode and graphite plate as a counter electrode were parallelly separated by 5 cm. The AO-ZIF-67 was deposited onto CS at a voltage of 5.0 V for 10 min. The obtained AO-ZIF-67/CS was then rinsed with methanol and dried at 70 °C. If ammonium oxalate was not used in the electrolyte, ZIF-67/CS could be prepared under the same condition.
clean_text:
Preparation of Wedge-Shaped AO-ZIF-67/CS

The methanol/water (V:V = 1:10) solution containing 0.018 mol/L of cobalt nitrate hexahydrate, 0.145 mol/L of Hmim, and 0.012 mol/L of ammonium oxalate was used as electrolyte for electrodeposition of metal-organic frameworks ZIF-67. The CS as a working electrode and graphite plate as a counter electrode were parallelly separated by 5 cm. The AO-ZIF-67 was deposited onto CS at a voltage of 5.0 V for 10 min. The obtained AO-ZIF-67/CS was then rinsed with methanol and dried at 70 °C. If ammonium oxalate was not used in the electrolyte, ZIF-67/CS could be prepared under the same condition.
